intro: Leonohebe haastii var. macrocalyx, commonly known as the broad-leaved leonohebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, lance-shaped leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its flowers, which range in color from pale purple to white, bloom in spring and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. This variety is noted for its hardiness and is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
